metadata.title: CVE-2021-3426 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: There's a flaw in Python 3's pydoc. A local or adjacent attacker whodiscovers or is able to convince another local or adjacent user to start apydoc server could access the server and use it to disclose sensitiveinformation belonging to the other user that they would not normally beable to access. The highest risk of this flaw is to data confidentiality.This flaw affects Python versions before 3.8.9, Python versions before3.9.3 and Python versions before 3.10.0a7.

criterions.comment: python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
